case_studies.title: The Amazon Refund Trap

incident.description: Victim received a call from someone claiming to be from Amazon customer care. The caller had the victim's order details and said a refund of ₹1,200 was pending due to a cancelled order.
incident.hook: The caller knew specific order details, making it seem legitimate
scam_execution: Caller asked victim to install 'AnyDesk' app for 'verification'
Once installed, scammer gained remote access to victim's phone
Scammer navigated to banking app while distracting victim
Multiple transactions were made totaling ₹45,000
red_flags_missed: Amazon never calls proactively for refunds
Remote access request is never legitimate
Urgency created: 'Refund will expire in 24 hours'

case_studies.outcome: Victim reported to cybercrime portal. Bank partially recovered ₹15,000. Case under investigation.
lessons: Never install remote access apps on anyone's request
Amazon processes refunds automatically through the app/website
Verify independently by logging into your account
No legitimate company asks for screen access

case_studies.title: Flipkart OTP Phishing

incident.description: Victim received SMS about a ₹2,500 refund for a cancelled Flipkart order. Message included a phone number to call for 'faster processing'.
scam_execution: Victim called the number from SMS
Scammer asked for 'account verification' using OTP
Victim received actual OTP from bank (scammer initiated transaction)
Victim shared OTP thinking it was for Flipkart verification
₹28,500 was immediately debited from bank account
red_flags_missed: Flipkart never asks to call for refunds
OTP sharing is NEVER required for refunds
Phone number in SMS was not official Flipkart number

case_studies.outcome: Victim filed FIR and complaint on cybercrime.gov.in. Money not recovered as transferred to multiple accounts.
lessons: NEVER share OTP with anyone - even if they claim to be from bank/company
OTP is only for YOUR use when YOU initiate a transaction
Verify sender's number with official website contact
Banks never ask for OTP over phone

case_studies.title: Meesho QR Code Scam

incident.description: Victim received WhatsApp message about a Meesho order refund. Message included a 'customer care executive' contact.
incident.hook: WhatsApp message with Meesho logo and order number
scam_execution: Victim contacted the 'executive' on WhatsApp
Scammer sent a QR code image
Said 'scan this to receive your refund of ₹800'
Victim scanned QR code using payment app
Instead of receiving money, ₹12,000 was deducted
red_flags_missed: Refunds are credited automatically, not via QR codes
QR codes are for making payments, not receiving them
Communication via WhatsApp instead of official app

case_studies.outcome: Victim blocked scammer and reported to bank. ₹3,000 recovered by freezing receiving account.
lessons: QR codes DEDUCT money, they never add money to your account
Refunds are always credited directly to original payment method
Don't trust WhatsApp messages claiming to be from companies
Check Meesho app directly for refund status

case_studies.title: PhonePe Wrong Payment Scam

incident.description: Victim received ₹500 in PhonePe account followed by immediate call claiming it was a 'wrong payment' that needs to be returned.
incident.hook: Actual money received first, making scam seem legitimate
scam_execution: Scammer sent ₹500 to create trust
Called victim saying it was a mistake, please return
Victim agreed to return the ₹500
Scammer sent a 'payment request link'
Link was actually for ₹67,500 (extra zero added)
In hurry, victim approved without checking amount
red_flags_missed: Scammer creating urgency and emotional pressure
Not verifying exact amount before approving

case_studies.outcome: FIR filed. Scammer's account traced but money already withdrawn. Partial recovery pending.
lessons: Always check payment amount before confirming
Wrong payments can be reversed by bank, no need to send back
Contact PhonePe support directly for such issues
Don't act under pressure or emotional manipulation
